newsitem.title: UK: European veg oils end mixed in pre-holiday trade.
newsitem.headline: European veg oils end mixed in pre-holiday trade.

text.p: The European vegetable oil market was in holiday mood on Wednesday afternoon with most of Europe closed on Thursday for the Ascension Day holiday.
Malaysian private forecaster Ivan Wong's latest estimate of local palm oil output and stocks for April was the only major factor in the market.
Wong estimated local palm oil output at 723,000 tonnes during April, up six percent.
Stocks were projected at 695,000 tonnes against 689,633 tonnes at end-March.
European traders said the report was friendly in the short term.
"At the moment the Wong report looks friendly with output rising by only six percent, but it may not look that good if demand does not pick up," said one.
However, traders said the rest of the market was slow ahead of various holidays on Thursday and lacked any fresh leads which was creating a neglected atmosphere.
Crude palm oil cif Europe closed unchanged to $2.50 up and products were $2.50 up to $2.50 down for RBD palm oil. Olein was unchanged to $2.50 higher.
Coconut oil finished with sellers $10 up to $2.50 lower after May/Jun traded at $672.50 and Jun/Jul at $660 a tonne cif.
Palmkernel oil closed unchanged to $2.50 lower with no buyers in sight.
"You can't even see any buyers with a telescope," said one trader.
Dutch soy oil closed 0.50 guilders down to unchanged after May/Jul traded at 106.75 guilders a 100 kilos fob ex-mill.
Rape oil closed mixed at 0.50 guilders up to 0.50 guilders down after Aug/Oct traded at 107.50 guilders.
